function.name: view
function.description: View a file or directory. For files, optionally search within the file using a regex pattern or limit to a line range. Exclude the 'electron' folder by default unless explicitly requested.

type.description: Whether to view a single file or a directory listing (up to 2 levels).

path.description: Path relative to the repository root.

view_range.description: Optional [start_line, end_line] 1-based inclusive range for files.

search_query_regex.description: Optional regex to search within file content (single-line regex).

case_sensitive.description: Whether the regex search is case-sensitive.

context_lines_before.description: Lines of context to include before each regex match.

context_lines_after.description: Lines of context to include after each regex match.

function.name: grep-search
function.description: Search across multiple files/directories or the whole codebase. Use for finding text/symbols across many files. Excludes 'electron/**' by default unless explicitly overridden.

query.description: Text or regex to search for.

paths.description: Optional list of directories or files to limit the search scope.

exclude_globs.description: Optional glob patterns to exclude. Defaults to excluding the 'electron' folder.

context_lines_before.description: Lines of context before each match.

context_lines_after.description: Lines of context after each match.

max_results.description: Limit the number of matches returned.

function.name: codebase-retrieval
function.description: High-level retrieval across the current codebase to locate relevant files, classes, functions, or patterns when you don't know where to look.

information_request.description: Natural-language description of what you need to find.

function.name: git-commit-retrieval
function.description: Use the repository’s commit history to find how similar changes were made in the past or why changes happened.

information_request.description: Question about past changes (e.g., how/why a feature was implemented).

function.name: str-replace-editor
function.description: Edit existing files safely. Use 'str_replace' for in-place replacements with explicit line ranges, or 'insert' to insert new content at a specific line.

path.description: Path of the file to edit, relative to repo root.

instruction_reminder.description: Must be exactly: 'ALWAYS BREAK DOWN EDITS INTO SMALLER CHUNKS OF AT MOST 150 LINES EACH.'

insert_line_1.description: For 'insert': 1-based line number after which to insert. Use 0 to insert at the very beginning.

old_str_1.description: For 'str_replace': the exact original text to replace (must match exactly, including whitespace).

function.name: save-file
function.description: Create a new file. Does not modify existing files.

instructions_reminder.description: Must be exactly: 'LIMIT THE FILE CONTENT TO AT MOST 300 LINES. IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.'

path.description: Path for the new file, relative to repo root.

file_content.description: Content to write into the new file.

add_last_line_newline.description: Whether to ensure a trailing newline.

function.name: remove-files
function.description: Delete files from the workspace in a reversible way.

file_paths.description: List of file paths to remove, relative to repo root.

function.name: launch-process
function.description: Run a shell command. Use wait=true for short commands. OS is win32; shell is 'bash'.

wait.description: Whether to wait for the process to complete.

cwd.description: Absolute working directory for the command.

function.name: read-process
function.description: Read output from a previously launched process.

function.name: write-process
function.description: Write input to a running process’s stdin.

function.name: kill-process
function.description: Kill a running process by terminal ID.

function.name: list-processes
function.description: List all known terminals created with the launch-process tool.

function.name: diagnostics
function.description: Return IDE issues (errors, warnings, etc.) for specified files.

paths.description: List of file paths to get issues for.

function.name: read-terminal
function.description: Read the visible output from the active or most-recently used VSCode terminal.

only_selected.description: Whether to read only the selected text.

function.name: open-browser
function.description: Open a URL in the default browser.

function.name: web-search
function.description: Search the web using Google Custom Search API.

function.name: web-fetch
function.description: Fetch a webpage and return its content in Markdown format.

function.name: view-range-untruncated
function.description: View a specific line range from previously truncated content by reference ID.

function.name: search-untruncated
function.description: Search within previously untruncated content by reference ID.

function.name: view_tasklist
function.description: View the current task list for the conversation.

function.name: add_tasks
function.description: Add one or more new tasks (and optional subtasks) to the task list.

function.name: update_tasks
function.description: Update one or more tasks' properties (state, name, description). Prefer batch updates.

function.name: reorganize_tasklist
function.description: Major restructuring of the task list using a full markdown representation.

markdown.description: Full task list in markdown with exactly one root task.

function.name: remember
function.description: Store long-term memory that can be useful in future interactions.

function.name: render-mermaid
function.description: Render a Mermaid diagram from the provided definition.
